playbook.title: Playbook: phishing simulation A–Z
playbook.intro: This playbook describes an authorized simulation for awareness training and process testing. Always follow the law, internal policies, and have the organization’s consent.
playbook.safetyNote: Never collect real passwords, don’t impersonate third parties without consent, and never operate outside the approved scope. In sandbox use test addresses and whitelisted domains.

steps.label: Preparation & approval
paragraphs: Confirm scope (departments/users), timeline and goals (open/click/report rate).
Obtain written authorization + contacts for SOC/IT/Helpdesk.
Agree on data retention and reporting recipients.

steps.label: Import & segmentation of recipients
paragraphs: Load users (CSV/API) and segment by teams/locations.
Exclude sensitive addresses—service accounts, shared HR mailboxes.
Optionally enable opt-out and a small pilot test group.

steps.label: Choose sender domain (prepared)
paragraphs: Pick one of the prepared sender domains (tech setup handled).
Verify FROM display name and reply-to.
Make sure the domain is approved by the customer.

steps.label: Select email template & landing page
paragraphs: Choose template (language, difficulty) and assign a landing page.
Fill variables (e.g., {{name}}) and verify desktop/mobile previews.

steps.label: Campaign settings
paragraphs: Set sender, reply-to, UTM parameters and throttling.
Add seed/test addresses and report recipients.
Respect working hours and local holidays.

steps.label: Pilot send
paragraphs: Send to a small sample and verify deliverability (MailHog/seed).
Check rendering across clients (Outlook/Web/Mobile).
After stakeholder approval, proceed to production waves.

steps.label: Launch
paragraphs: Schedule waves (time windows, randomization).
Enable soft-bounce retry as per policy.
Prepare a panic/stop procedure for incidents.

steps.label: Live monitoring
paragraphs: Track opens, clicks, form submissions and phishing reports.
Never store real passwords—collect safe indicators only.
Coordinate with Helpdesk/SOC on potential incidents.

steps.label: Evaluation & awareness
paragraphs: Produce reports (BRS, open/click/report, team heatmaps).
Plan follow-up micro-training and recommendations for leads.
Record lessons learned and propose improvements.

steps.label: Retest & archiving
paragraphs: Plan a retest in 30–90 days and compare trends.
Export results, anonymize per policy/retention and archive.
Close the campaign and update process docs.
